intro: Packera paupercula var. paupercula, commonly known as the slenderleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and rough, hairy foliage. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, yellowish to pale green flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine, stiff hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments.
